member.name: T:Project_5.My.Resources.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:Project_5.My.Resources.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:Project_5.My.Resources.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: F:Project_5.frmDisplay.curFont
member.summary: The PrintDialog allows the user to select the printer that they want to print to, as well as other printing options.

member.name: M:Project_5.frmDisplay.btnPrintPreview_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: The PrintPreviewDialog is associated with the PrintDocument as the preview is rendered, the PrintPage event is triggered. This event is passed a graphics context where it "draws" the page.

member.name: M:Project_5.frmDisplay.btnPageSetup_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Page setup lets you specify things like the paper size, portrait, landscape, etc.

member.name: M:Project_5.frmDisplay.frmDisplay_Load(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Handles the Form's Load event, initializing the TextBox with some text for printing.

member.name: M:Project_5.frmDisplay.pdoc_PrintPage(System.Object,System.Drawing.Printing.PrintPageEventArgs)
member.summary:
PrintPage is the printing event. This event gets fired for every page that will be printed. You could also handle the BeginPrint and EndPrint events for more control.
The following is very fast and useful for plain text as MeasureString calculates the text that can be fitted on an entire page. This is not that useful, however, for formatted text. In that case you would want to have word-level (vs page-level) control, which is more complicated.
